dear (what a wife calls a husband)

Japanese: あの, あのう, あのー

(after the -te form of a verb indicating) continuing action or state

Japanese: おととい, いっさくじつ、おとつい
おととし、いっさくねん

English: (of a guest, customer, etc...) to leave
(cloth, leather, etc... NOT paper, plastic) bag
(the …) river (suffix used with the names of rivers)
to put on (from the shoulders down)
(after te-form of a verb or a noun prefixed with o- or go-) please (do for me)
This (indicating an item near the speaker, the action of the speaker, or the current topic)
Such (about something/someone close to the speaker (including the speaker), or about ideas expressed by the speaker)
(with names of teachers, etc. as an) honorific title
then (of some incident just spoken of)
that (something or someone distant from the speaker, close to the listener; actions of the listener, or ideas expressed or understood by the listener)
that (indicating an item or person near the listener, the action of the listener, or something on their mind)
to not be in the usual condition
to not match the correct (answer, etc...)
to be worn out (e.g. of well used objects)
to go out (e.g. on an excursion or outing)
next to (esp. living next door to)
(indicating an approximate quote or vague suggestion) or something
(lessening the significance or value of the previous word) the likes of
to go to bed, to lie in bed
OK (used to get attention prior to an utterance)
to put on (lower-body clothing i.e. pants, skirt, etc...)
to retreat (from battle), to take flight
to be cleared (e.g. of a suspicion)
to play (an instrument with strings, including piano)
low (height, tone, rank, degree, cost, etc...)
for one thing (often used in itemized lists)
